position.marginalia_text: Calor calefacit rem sibi superposita[m]: et calefaciendo facit evaporare humiditate[m]: qua humiditate o[mn]es partes sicca[e] terrea[e] co[n]tinuabantur, & faciebant vnum corpus co[n]tinuum, et vna[m] re[m]: & ita calor corrumpit & putrefacit ip[sa]m re[m]; sicut videtur in ligno in igne posito [etc]

marginalia.translation: Heat heats the things that is placed above it. And by heating it, the heat makes it evaporate humidity. With this humidity all dry and earthy parts were linked together and made one continuous body and one thing. And thus heat corrupts and putrefies the thing itself, like seen in wood placed into a fire etc.
After the separation of water and oil.
